name: Developer Configuration Management
description: The organization requires that information system developers create and implement a configuration management plan that controls changes to the system during development, tracks security flaws, requires authorization of changes, and provides documentation of the plan and its implementation.
supplemental_guidance: This control also applies to the development actions associated with information system changes.

rev5.name: Developer Configuration Management
rev5.changes_from_rev4: Adds 'disposal' to parameter text selections Adds 'privacy' to control text

attack_techniques.name: Software Deployment Tools
attack_techniques.mapping_rationale: Developer configuration management ensures software deployment tools are developed with security controls, change tracking, and vulnerability management that prevent adversary exploitation of deployment infrastructure.

attack_techniques.name: Valid Accounts
attack_techniques.mapping_rationale: Configuration management during development ensures default credentials are changed, test accounts are removed, and secure authentication is implemented before production deployment, eliminating default access vectors.

attack_techniques.name: Firmware Corruption
attack_techniques.mapping_rationale: Developer configuration management with firmware integrity controls ensures that only authorized, tracked changes reach firmware images, preventing introduction of corrupting modifications during development.

attack_techniques.name: Server Software Component
attack_techniques.mapping_rationale: Configuration management for server software components tracks all modules, extensions, and plugins through the development lifecycle, detecting unauthorized introduction of backdoor components.

attack_techniques.name: Pre-OS Boot
attack_techniques.mapping_rationale: Developer configuration management over boot sequences and pre-OS components ensures firmware and bootloader changes are tracked, authorized, and security-reviewed before deployment.

attack_techniques.name: Subvert Trust Controls
attack_techniques.mapping_rationale: Configuration management for trust control components, including certificate handling and code signing, ensures that trust verification mechanisms are not weakened during the development lifecycle.

attack_techniques.name: Modify System Image
attack_techniques.mapping_rationale: Developer configuration management for network device system images ensures that firmware builds are tracked, changes are authorized, and integrity is verified throughout the development pipeline.

attack_techniques.name: Plist File Modification
attack_techniques.mapping_rationale: Configuration management for plist files during development ensures that property list configurations are tracked and changes are authorized, preventing introduction of malicious configuration modifications.

attack_techniques.name: Default Accounts
attack_techniques.mapping_rationale: Developer configuration management mandates removal of default accounts and credentials before release, eliminating factory-set passwords that adversaries exploit for initial access to deployed systems.

attack_techniques.name: Local Accounts
attack_techniques.mapping_rationale: Configuration management during development ensures local service and administrative accounts are properly secured with unique credentials, preventing exploitation of development-era default configurations.

attack_techniques.name: Cloud Accounts
attack_techniques.mapping_rationale: Developer configuration management for cloud deployments ensures cloud account credentials are properly rotated and test accounts are removed before production, eliminating default cloud access.

attack_techniques.name: Compromise Software Dependencies and Development Tools
attack_techniques.mapping_rationale: Configuration management over the software development pipeline tracks dependencies, build tools, and third-party libraries, detecting supply chain compromises that introduce malicious code through development toolchains.

attack_techniques.name: Compromise Hardware Supply Chain
attack_techniques.mapping_rationale: Developer configuration management for hardware components ensures that supply chain integrity is maintained through component tracking, verification, and authorized vendor management during manufacturing.

attack_techniques.name: Code Repositories
attack_techniques.mapping_rationale: Configuration management for code repositories ensures access controls, branch protections, and audit trails prevent unauthorized access to source code and detect suspicious repository activity.

attack_techniques.name: SQL Stored Procedures
attack_techniques.mapping_rationale: Developer configuration management tracks SQL stored procedures through the development lifecycle, detecting unauthorized introduction of malicious procedures that provide persistent database-level backdoor access.

attack_techniques.name: Transport Agent
attack_techniques.mapping_rationale: Configuration management for mail server components ensures transport agents are tracked, authorized, and security-reviewed before deployment, preventing introduction of malicious email interceptors.

attack_techniques.name: IIS Components
attack_techniques.mapping_rationale: Developer configuration management for IIS components tracks module development, registration, and deployment, detecting unauthorized introduction of malicious ISAPI extensions or managed modules.

attack_techniques.name: System Firmware
attack_techniques.mapping_rationale: Configuration management for system firmware development ensures all firmware changes are tracked, authorized, and integrity-verified, preventing introduction of malicious modifications to BIOS/UEFI images.

attack_techniques.name: Bootkit
attack_techniques.mapping_rationale: Developer configuration management over boot component development ensures bootloader integrity through tracked builds, code signing, and authorization, preventing bootkit introduction during development.

attack_techniques.name: ROMMONkit
attack_techniques.mapping_rationale: Configuration management for ROMMON development ensures all ROM Monitor firmware changes are authorized and tracked, preventing adversary introduction of malicious ROMMON modifications.

attack_techniques.name: TFTP Boot
attack_techniques.mapping_rationale: Developer configuration management for network boot images ensures TFTP-served boot files are integrity-verified and tracked, preventing adversary substitution of malicious boot images.

attack_techniques.name: Code Signing Policy Modification
attack_techniques.mapping_rationale: Configuration management over code signing policy ensures that signing certificates, policies, and verification mechanisms are tracked and authorized changes are documented, preventing policy weakening.

attack_techniques.name: XPC Services
attack_techniques.mapping_rationale: Developer configuration management for XPC services ensures service definitions, entitlements, and communication interfaces are security-reviewed and tracked throughout the macOS development lifecycle.

attack_techniques.name: Resource Forking
attack_techniques.mapping_rationale: Configuration management tracking resource fork content during development detects unauthorized addition of hidden data in macOS resource forks that could conceal malicious payloads.

attack_techniques.name: DLL Side-Loading
attack_techniques.mapping_rationale: Developer configuration management ensures applications load DLLs from expected paths with proper manifests, preventing DLL side-loading vulnerabilities through secure development and build practices.

attack_techniques.name: Patch System Image
attack_techniques.mapping_rationale: Configuration management over system image development ensures that patches to network device firmware are authorized, tracked, and integrity-verified before deployment.

attack_techniques.name: Downgrade System Image
attack_techniques.mapping_rationale: Developer configuration management prevents unauthorized image downgrades by maintaining version control and authorization records for all system image releases deployed to network devices.
